intro: Lodhra hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy ash tree, is a deciduous tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Salicaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and alternate, simple leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, followed by the development of elongated, cylindrical fruits. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. The plant has traditional medicinal uses in Ayurveda, where various parts of the tree are utilized for their therapeutic properties.
